channel.title: Toronto International Film Festival on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Toronto International Film Festival on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: TIFF Hidden Gem: ‘Motor City’ Speaks Volumes Without Saying a Word
item.description: Director Potsy Ponciroli trades dialogue for raw emotion, plenty of needle drops and muscle in a 70’s era revenge tale led by Alan Ritchson and Shailene Woodley.

item.title: TIFF Hidden Gem: ‘Motor City’ Speaks Volumes Without Saying a Word
item.description: Director Potsy Ponciroli trades dialogue for raw emotion, plenty of needle drops and muscle in a 70’s era revenge tale led by Alan Ritchson and Shailene Woodley.

item.title: TIFF Flashback: When Lee Byung-hun Made Toronto ‘Magnificent’
item.description: The South Korean star visited the fest in 2016 as part of the starry cast, including Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke and Chris Pratt, of director Antoine Fuqua’s remake of ‘The Magnificent Seven.’

item.title: TIFF Flashback: When Lee Byung-hun Made Toronto ‘Magnificent’
item.description: The South Korean star visited the fest in 2016 as part of the starry cast, including Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke and Chris Pratt, of director Antoine Fuqua’s remake of ‘The Magnificent Seven.’

item.title: James McAvoy Allegedly Attacked in Toronto Bar While Premiering ‘California Schemin” at TIFF
item.description: James McAvoy was reportedly attacked in a Toronto bar on Monday while attending the Toronto International Film Festival to screen his directorial debut, “California Schemin’.” Accord

item.description: James McAvoy was reportedly attacked in a Toronto bar on Monday while attending the Toronto International Film Festival to screen his directorial debut, “California Schemin’.” Accord

item.title: TIFF Flashback: Toni Collette Walked ‘In Her Shoes’ Down the Carpet
item.description: In Curtis Hanson’s comedy/drama in 2005, the Australian actress starred as a slightly dowdy, buttoned-up lawyer.

item.title: TIFF Flashback: Toni Collette Walked ‘In Her Shoes’ Down the Carpet
item.description: In Curtis Hanson’s comedy/drama in 2005, the Australian actress starred as a slightly dowdy, buttoned-up lawyer.

item.title: Chloé Zhao on Why She Took a Four Year Break From Filmmaking and Signed on to ‘Hamnet’ Only After Meeting Paul Mescal
item.description: The ‘Nomadland’ director returns with an adaptation of Maggie O’Farrell’s Shakespeare story after four years away from feature film: “I’m always guided by what comes from inside me.”

item.title: ‘The Christophers’ Review: Michaela Coel’s Steely Self-Possession and Ian McKellen’s Scalding Wit Are an Irresistible Match in Steven Soderbergh’s Tart Art Comedy
item.description: Jessica Gunning and James Corden also star as siblings angling to cash in on the looming death of their estranged father, a once-renowned painter.

item.title: TIFF Flashback: Newbie Keanu Reeves Was ‘The Prince’ of Toronto
item.description: It was something of a homecoming for the young Canadian actor, then aged 24, when he attended the Toronto International Film Festival in 1988.

item.title: ‘The Currents’ Review: A Woman Who Has Everything Comes Undone in a Lusciously Crafted Argentinian Spellbinder
item.description: Writer-director Milagros Mumenthaler’s film revolves around a successful young Buenos Aires fashion designer whose world is upended after a work trip gone awry.

item.description: Writer-director Milagros Mumenthaler’s film revolves around a successful young Buenos Aires fashion designer whose world is upended after a work trip gone awry.

item.description: Miles Teller and Callum Turner also star in this glossy, mass-appeal rom-com, which premiered in Toronto before its planned November release.

item.description: Premiering at TIFF, the ‘Green Border’ director’s non-chronological feature views the Czech-German-Jewish writer’s life as if through a crystal prism.

item.description: Based on a late-‘90s robbery spree and the prison break and fugitive months that followed, the film boasts a supporting cast including LaKeith Stanfield, Juno Temple and Peter Dinklage.

item.title: ‘The Lost Bus’ Review: Matthew McConaughey and America Ferrera Are Affecting as Modest Heroes in Paul Greengrass’ Visceral Real-Life Wildfire Thriller
item.description: Mixing docudrama with a story of human courage, the Apple TV+ film recreates the deadliest blaze in California history and the determination of two strangers to rescue 22 schoolchildren.

item.description: Mixing docudrama with a story of human courage, the Apple TV+ film recreates the deadliest blaze in California history and the determination of two strangers to rescue 22 schoolchildren.

item.description: Billy Corben’s TIFF-premiering documentary explores the rise and fall of the butter-loving Southern chef, revisiting her N-word scandal 12 years later.

item.description: Billy Corben’s TIFF-premiering documentary explores the rise and fall of the butter-loving Southern chef, revisiting her N-word scandal 12 years later.

item.title: James Vanderbilt on Pitting Russell Crowe Against Rami Malek in TIFF Thriller ‘Nuremberg’
item.description: The star-studded character piece about the Nuremberg Trials and showdown between a high-ranking Nazi and a psychiatrist, world premieres at Toronto: “We talked a lot about ‘The Silence of the Lambs.’”

item.description: The star-studded character piece about the Nuremberg Trials and showdown between a high-ranking Nazi and a psychiatrist, world premieres at Toronto: “We talked a lot about ‘The Silence of the Lambs.’”

item.description: The Oscar winner discusses reimagining Shakespeare through a modern South Asian lens — where ancestral spirits and corporate greed haunt the streets of London: “It’s a timeless story.”

item.description: Based on the life of Christy Martin, who helped legitimize women’s boxing, the film also stars Ben Foster as the trainer who becomes her abusive husband.
